Furthermore, the lens flare is described as static, but in an arcing shot, it would likely shift its position, perhaps moving from the top-left corner across the top of the frame as the camera's angle to the light source changes. The description also misses the parallax effect in the background; as the camera circles the foreground subject, the middle-ground plain and the background mountains would appear to shift at different speeds, a key element of the scene's depth and movement that should be noted.
